title.narrative: Vision for Zambia

description.narrative: Vision for Zambia aims to reduce childhood blindness and visual impairment of targeted children in 10 districts of Copperbelt Province, Zambia.

activity-date.narrative: The planned project end date is 30 June 2019.

mailing-address.narrative: Orbis UK, 6th Floor, 10 Lower Thames Street, EC3R 6AF

title.narrative: Grant application/proposal form, Vision for Zambia
Logframe, Vision for Zambia
Budget Summary, Vision for Zambia
Output 3

description.narrative: 11 Health Personnel (Paediatric ophthalmologists, nurses and biomedical staff) at Kitwe Eye Annex have increased capacity to provide high quality sub speciality paediatric eye surgery and post op care through hospital based programmes

title.narrative: % of health personnel reporting improved knowledge and skills to conduct paediatric eye surgery and treatments during hospital based programmes
# of health professionals trained at tertiary level
Output 2

description.narrative: 766 Health Professionals at community, primary and district level, in 10 districts in Copperbelt province have improved capacity to identify, screen, treat basic conditions where appropriate and refer children with eye health conditions.

title.narrative: % of (and description of cases) where trainees have applied learning in their work at three month follow up
Number of health care facilities receiving small eye health diagnostic equipment
Number of health professionals trained to identify, refer and treat where appropriate, children with eye health conditions
% trainees who demonstrate adequate knowledge of eye health care and referrals through achieving a benchmark score of 80% in post-training assessment
Outcome 1

description.narrative: 89,945 children in the Zambia Copperbelt Province take up quality eye health services and follow up care at the appropriate level

title.narrative: Number of paediatric patients' (aged 0-4 years) first OPD (out-patient department) attendance for eye disease at primary or district health facility

description.narrative: Outcome Indicator for Year 1 only

title.narrative: Number of paediatric patients' (aged 0-14 years) first OPD attendance for all eye disease at all health facilities in the Copperbelt Province
% of sampled paediatric patients referred for specialised care who complete the referral and receive treatment
% of paediatric eye surgical patients successfully followed up 6 months post surgery
Output 4

description.narrative: Improved coordination between district health personnel in the Copperbelt Province in planning, service delivery, feedback and information sharing of referrals.

title.narrative: # of coordination meetings held
Output 1

description.narrative: Increased community awareness of eye health conditions and services available through targeted communication campaigns including facilitated film screenings, radio shows and distribution of IEC materials in 10 districts of the Copperbelt Province.

title.narrative: Number of community members reached through facilitated film screenings
Estimated # of community members reached by airings of radio messaging on eye health annually
% of community members interviewed after attending community awareness activity reporting improved knowledge of eye health care and services available
